title: What are 5 specific reasons why the Filipinos wanted to free the Philippines from Spain? - Quora

response.answer_text: The whole Philippine Revolution against Spanish and eventually American colonial rule was a nativization of preexisting consolidation of similar fragmented sociopolitical identities into a single nation states like American and Latin American War of Independence and destruction of sectarian and aristocratic-based political systems like French Revolution. Because of these preexisting revolutions across the globe, any kinds of native-based revolutions against colonial (whether against European-born leaders or monastic-based Catholic religious groups) rule was always inevitable and the Philippines was not that immune for such inevitable reality due to excesses of friar domination in the Spanish colonial rule in the country and easier access to news and reading materials about American, French, Latin American, German, or Italian revolutions, so Philippine founding leaders like José Rizal, Andres Bonifacio, Apolinario Mabini, Emilio Aguinaldo, Antonio Luna, and others had already read the works of Thomas Jefferson, Alexe de Tocqueville, Simón Bolivar, Niccolo Machiavelli, or even Karl Marx. So, due to these events in local and global histories I’ve mentioned, a revolt against Spanish and eventually, American colonial rules was already inevitable for the Philippines. The problem on why the revolution failed was due to lack of necessary urgency among the general population by 1890s to revolt against the Spaniards and because of that, it was exploited by the American successors, so Philippine revolutionaries should have waited a certain boiling point to ignite an economic-based revolution by 20 more years just like in Mexican and Russian revolutions.

Reasons why natives wanted freedom from the Spaniards: a) forced free labor with the natives even bringing their own food to public/church works, b) tributes or taxes, c) forced resettlement into towns or “pueblos”, c) abuses of the Spanish priests - the friars - they can do almost anything within their parishes, even having sexual intercourse with women w/o consent and getting the best farmlands leaving poor farms to the natives, d) forced recruitment into the Spanish civil guards to fight wars in Mindanao and outside the Phils, and e) discrimination - the Spaniards look down on the natives, and do not hide it - contempt for the brown-skinned natives by the white-skinned Spaniards, no dignity there.
